nodes.label: ATO Records
nodes.quote: "Aesthetic nodding to a vintage-era RZA production, Quesada crafts an LP that unfurls like a puma stalking its prey."
nodes.title: S/T

nodes.label: Amazon Music/Nacional Records
nodes.quote: "Here you’ll find cutting funk..., bright, guitar-first mid-tempo tracks like those made in the famous Muscle Shoals studio in the late Sixties, and the aching, post-doo-wop sound often labelled lowrider soul."
nodes.title: Look At My Soul: The Latin Shade of Texas Soul

nodes.label: Fat Beats Records
nodes.quote: "The guys in Brownout have done it again."
nodes.title: Fear of a Brown Planet

nodes.label: Blue Élan Records
nodes.quote: "Bursting at the seams with energy, vicious in spleen, and touching in tenderness."
nodes.title: Pinkville

nodes.label: Third Root Music
nodes.quote: "...a powerful body of work that reflects the times we’re living in."
nodes.title: Libertad

nodes.label: Third Root Music
nodes.quote: "...the mix feels vibrant and luminous yet retains an approachability that any fan of rap and hip-hop can digest."
nodes.title: Trill Pedagogy Series Spring through Winter

nodes.label: Nine Mile Records
nodes.quote: "...an immediate and... affecting piece of work."
nodes.title: S/T

nodes.label: Nacional Records
nodes.quote: "...Quesada is a tremendous storyteller, and Echo Hotel represents a significant contribution to his growing legacy."
nodes.title: Echo Hotel

nodes.label: Ubiquity Records
nodes.quote: "Adrian Quesada is a man on a mission!"
nodes.title: Trans-Atlantic Psych Classics Vol. 1

nodes.label: Ubiquity Records
nodes.quote: "[A]n intoxicating mix of soupy sounds, soulful vocals, reverb aplenty, and a bottom end that never quits."
nodes.title: Trans-Atlantic Psych Classics Vol. 2

nodes.label: ESL Records
nodes.quote: "...brings to you cinematic orchestra stylings, psychedelic Afro-Latin funk grooves, and Latin breakbeat rhythms that at times make you feel like you're at the coolest 3 a.m. party, and at others times like you're floating in the middle of a Mexican desert."
nodes.title: Taurus

nodes.label: Nat Geo Music
nodes.quote: "...Quesada clearly knows what he's doing behind the boards as well as on his instrument."
nodes.title: El Existential

nodes.label: ESL Records
nodes.quote: "Rarely has laidback funk felt so vibrant, so alive, with an exquisite organic feel-good vibe that brings a smile to the lips of the listener."
nodes.title: El Niño y el Sol

nodes.label: Nacional Records
nodes.quote: "...a remarkably cohesive work drawing on everything from tango to house and hip-hop."
nodes.title: Lumen

nodes.label: Ubiquity Records
nodes.quote: "...a southern-fried, laid back, and psychedelic-tinged album."
nodes.title: Sunshadows

nodes.label: Razor & Tie
nodes.quote: "...enters your eardrums and refuses to leave your headspace."
nodes.title: High Country

nodes.label: Nacional Records
nodes.quote: "...blends elements of '60s girl groups, rhythm-guitar-driven dance-pop, horn-backed tropicalia, and whirling synths."
nodes.title: Honey Bun
